issues.description: The problem statement and the template expect a public method named singFarmSong() in Farm (used to play the Old MacDonald song), but the solution implementation provides a public method named playFarmSong() instead. This is a method-signature/name mismatch: tests or graders that call singFarmSong() (as specified in the problem and present in the template) will not find that method in the solution Farm class. Additionally, the solution's Main still references farm.singFarmSong() (commented), creating an internal inconsistency within the solution repository.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the public method name consistent across artifacts. Recommended: rename the solution's public method playFarmSong() to singFarmSong() (and have it call the existing private singFarmSongVerse(Animal) for each animal). Also update the solution Main (if desired) to call farm.singFarmSong(). Alternatively, change the template and problem statement to use playFarmSong() everywhere, but keeping singFarmSong() (as in the problem/template) is the least disruptive option.

issues.description: The problem statement and the template repository specify a public Farm method named singFarmSong(), but the solution implementation uses the name playFarmSong() for the same public operation. This mismatch (same conceptual operation, different public method name) creates a mapping barrier: students reading the solution or comparing behavior may not immediately find the expected singFarmSong() method in the solution and could be confused about the intended public API.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the public method name across artifacts. Prefer renaming the solution's public method playFarmSong() to singFarmSong() (and update any internal callers) so it matches the problem statement and template. Alternatively, if 'playFarmSong' is preferred, update the problem statement and template to use that name consistently — but one consistent name across all artifacts is required.
